About Me

Hey there! I'm Luka and I just love creating "something out of nothing" since I learned to pronounce that name. And that was about 26 years ago. I consider myself quite innovative, and when it comes to art of any kind, I enjoy complexity which is full of tiny details. Speaking of that - I've been experimenting with sound for more than ten years now, producing all sorts of pleasant and not so pleasant sounds.

I've discovered the world of Web development on april 2015. Felt more "at home" on a client-side, so I headed in that direction. I don't have any real experience at this field, but I am capable of creating decently looking, dynamic layouts. And I really enjoy doing that.

About This Website

First of all - design of this website in no way reflects my character. The site itself could be considered as an experiment which, at the end, came out pretty interesting. Yes, it probably is overwhelmed by unnecessary animations, transitions and unnecessary stuff overall, and the point of all that is to show some of the skills and knowledge I managed to get over the time... and to have some fun.

Now the technical part. This website has been built and designed completely from scratch. So, except for jQuery and Normalize.css, there aren't any external source code, which means - no CSS frameworks, grids, no JavaScript/jQuery plugins, etc.

Music on this site has been produced by me as well. -Music? -Yeah, music.

Shout-out

I've learned everything I know so far by looking various Youtube tutorials and reading numerous articles all over the Web, which were made by people kind enough to share their knowledge for absolutely free. So, I'd like to thank them all:

- LearnCode.academy

- LevelUpTuts

- Thenewboston

- Accio Code

- DevTips

- Codrops

- CSS-Tricks

- Codecademy

And of course, big up goes to all the people who contributed to Stack Overflow and saved my day so many times.

Four

I like that number.

Technologies I Use
Read More

html

Doing my best to write it semantic and clean, although I like to complicate things, so my markup may look strange at the first sight.

Read More

css

Writing it in SASS and using most of the functions and possibilities of CSS3. I can make website responsive and cross-browser compatible.

Read More

javascript

With jQuery and Google combined, I can make almost anything I want, one way or another. AngularJS is my next target.

Other Tools

As you probably noticed, I'm not coming from a design background. Although I'm familiar with some basic functions of Adobe Photoshop and know how to draw beautiful circles and rectangles using Adobe Illustrator.

When it comes to Web development, I use Gulp as a task runner. I've used Grunt as well, but for some reason I prefer Gulp. While I'm at the "reasons", there are quite a bit for which I don't like Bootstrap. Yes, I know how to use it, but I just don't like it.
